title: Split/Collapse a dataset with repeating group of variables
removeColsWithConstantChk: Remove all columns with constant values (case insensitive) before splitting or collapsing
removeRowsWithNAsChk: Keep only complete cases i.e. remove entire row with any empty or NA values in output dataset(s)
resultDatasetNameSuffix: (Optional) one or more strings (comma separated) to be used as a suffix for the output dataset name(s)
splitDatasetRad: Split the dataset into multiple datasets based on the repeating variable set
autoDetectColGroupLengthRad: Automatically detect the repeating variable set to split or collapse
manualColGroupLengthRad: Specify the length of the repeating variable set to be used for splitting or collapsing
manualRepeatingColumnGroupLength: Length of the repeating variable set
outputColumnNames: (Optional) List of variable names (comma separated) to be used for the output dataset(s)
collapseDatasetRad: Collapse to create one long dataset instead of splitting into multiple datasets
collapseGpIDColName: Set ID variable name (a new variable will be created in the output dataset)
collapseGpIDColFirstChk: Make the Set ID variable the first column (uncheck for last column)
makeCollapseGpIDColFactorChk: Make Set ID variable a factor

help.title: Split/Collapse a dataset with repeating group of variables
help.body:
Description
This dialog is used to split (into multiple datasets) or collapse (into one long dataset) a dataset with repeated set of variables

Example 1: To try this, you may use the sample dataset file called Repeating Variable Sets.xlsx
Open the file in the data grid with the file open menu
In the dialog - type
There will be three datasets created as there are three repeating variable sets. you can type none, one, or more strings for output dataset name suffixes as abcX, abcY, abcZ
Keep every other item in the dialog as the default

Example 2: To try this, you may use the sample dataset file called Repeating Variable Sets2.xlsx
Open the file in the data grid with the file open menu
In the dialog - type
There will be four datasets created as there are four repeating variable sets
Keep every item in the dialog as the default

You may use the same two sample dataset files to try the option of Collapse in "Split or Collapse the dataset?" section of the dialog to create a single output dataset
